Label: Compressor
Comment: A compressor is a device that compresses a fluid typically used in a refrigeration circuit.

Label: Condenser
Comment: A condenser is a device that is used to dissipate heat, typically by condensing a substance such as a refrigerant from its gaseous to its liquid state.

Label: Controller
Comment:
A controller is a device that monitors inputs and controls outputs within a building automation system.

A controller may be physical (having placement within a spatial structure) or logical (a software interface or aggregated within a programmable physical controller).

Label: Cooled beam
Comment: A cooled beam (or chilled beam) is a device typically used to cool air by circulating a fluid such as chilled water through exposed finned tubes above a space. Typically mounted overhead near or within a ceiling, the cooled beam uses convection to cool the space below it by acting as a heat sink for the naturally rising warm air of the space. Once cooled, the air naturally drops back to the floor where the cycle begins again.

Label: Cooling tower
Comment: A cooling tower is a device which rejects heat to ambient air by circulating a fluid such as water through it to reduce its temperature by partial evaporation.

Label: Damper
Comment: A damper typically participates in an HVAC duct distribution system and is used to control or modulate the flow of air.

Label: Distribution control device
Comment: Represents devices of a building automation control system that are used to impart control over elements of a distribution system. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcsharedbldgserviceelements/lexical/ifcdistributioncontrolelement.htm)

subClass.Label: Flow instrument
subClass.Comment:
A flow instrument reads and displays the value of a particular property of a system at a point, or displays the difference in the value of a property between two points.

Instrumentation is typically for the purpose of determining the value of the property at a point in time. It is not the purpose of an instrument to record or integrate the values over time (although they may be connected to recording devices that do perform such a function). This entity provides for all forms of mechanical flow instrument (thermometers, pressure gauges etc.) and electrical flow instruments (ammeters, voltmeters etc.)

subClass.Label: Protective device tripping unit
subClass.Comment: A protective device tripping unit breaks an electrical circuit at a separate breaking unit when a stated electric current that passes through the unit is exceeded.

subClass.Label: Sensor
subClass.Comment: A sensor is a device that measures a physical quantity and converts it into a signal which can be read by an observer or by an instrument.

subClass.Label: Unitary control element
subClass.Comment:
A unitary control element combines a number of control components into a single product, such as a thermostat or humidistat.

A unitary control element provides a housing for an aggregation of control or electrical distribution elements that, in combination, perform a singular (unitary) purpose. Each item in the aggregation may have its own geometric representation and location.

Label: Distribution device
Comment: Generalization of all devices that participate in a distribution system. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcproductextension/lexical/ifcdistributionelement.htm)

subClass.Label: DistributionFlowDevice
subClass.Comment: Represents devices of a distribution system that facilitate the distribution of energy or matter, such as air, water or power. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcsharedbldgserviceelements/lexical/ifcdistributionflowelement.htm)

Label: DistributionFlowDevice
Comment: Represents devices of a distribution system that facilitate the distribution of energy or matter, such as air, water or power. (Definition adapated from http://www.buildingsmart-tech.org/ifc/IFC4/Add1/html/schema/ifcsharedbldgserviceelements/lexical/ifcdistributionflowelement.htm)

subClass.Label: Energy conversion device
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element EnergyConversionDevice defines the occurrence of a device used to perform energy conversion or heat transfer and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

subClass.Label: Flow controller
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowController defines the occurrence of elements of a distribution system that are used to regulate flow through a distribution system. Examples include dampers, valves, switches, and relays.

subClass.Label: Flow moving device
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowMovingDevice defines the occurrence of an apparatus used to distribute, circulate or perform conveyance of fluids, including liquids and gases (such as a pump or fan), and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

subClass.Label: Flow storage device
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowStorageDevice defines the occurrence of a device that participates in a distribution system and is used for temporary storage (such as a tank).

subClass.Label: Flow terminal
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowTerminal defines the occurrence of a permanently attached element that acts as a terminus or beginning of a distribution system (such as an air outlet, drain, water closet, or sink). A terminal is typically a point at which a system interfaces with an external environment.

subClass.Label: Flow treatment device
subClass.Comment: The distribution flow element FlowTreatmentDevice defines the occurrence of a device typically used to remove unwanted matter from a fluid, either liquid or gas, and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

Label: Duct silencer
Comment: A duct silencer is a device that is typically installed inside a duct distribution system for the purpose of reducing the noise levels from air movement, fan noise, etc. in the adjacent space or downstream of the duct silencer device.

Label: Electric appliance
Comment:
An electric appliance is a device intended for consumer usage that is powered by electricity.

Electric appliances may be fixed in place or may be able to be moved from one space to another. Electric appliances require an electrical supply that may be supplied either by an electrical circuit or provided from a local battery source.

Label: Electric flow storage device
Comment: An electric flow storage device is a device in which electrical energy is stored and from which energy may be progressively released.

Label: Electric generator
Comment: An electric generator is an engine that is a machine for converting mechanical energy into electrical energy.

Label: Electric motor
Comment: An electric motor is an engine that is a machine for converting electrical energy into mechanical energy.

Label: Electric time control
Comment: An electric time control is a device that applies control to the provision or flow of electrical energy over time.

Label: Energy conversion device
Comment: The distribution flow element EnergyConversionDevice defines the occurrence of a device used to perform energy conversion or heat transfer and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

subClass.Label: Engine
subClass.Comment: An engine is a device that converts fuel into mechanical energy through combustion.

subClass.Label: Evaporative cooler
subClass.Comment: An evaporative cooler is a device that cools air by saturating it with water vapor.

subClass.Label: Evaporator
subClass.Comment: An evaporator is a device in which a liquid refrigerent is vaporized and absorbs heat from the surrounding fluid.

subClass.Label: Heat exchanger
subClass.Comment: A heat exchanger is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media such as plate and shell and tube heat exchangers. HeatExchanger is commonly used on water-side distribution systems to recover energy from a liquid to another liquid (typically water-based), whereas AirToAirHeatRecovery is commonly used on air-side distribution systems to recover energy from a gas to a gas (usually air).

subClass.Label: Humidifier
subClass.Comment: A humidifier is a device that adds moisture into the air.

subClass.Label: Solar device
subClass.Comment: A solar device converts solar radiation into other energy such as electric current or thermal energy.

subClass.Label: Transformer
subClass.Comment:
A transformer is an inductive stationary device that transfers electrical energy from one circuit to another.

Transformer is used to transform electric power; conversion of electric signals for other purposes is handled at other entities: Controller converts arbitrary signals, AudioVisualAppliance converts signals for audio or video streams, and CommunicationsAppliance converts signals for data or other communications usage.

subClass.Label: Tube bundle
subClass.Comment: A tube bundle is a device consisting of tubes and bundles of tubes used for heat transfer and contained typically within other energy conversion devices, such as a chiller or coil.

Label: Engine
Comment: An engine is a device that converts fuel into mechanical energy through combustion.

Label: Evaporative cooler
Comment: An evaporative cooler is a device that cools air by saturating it with water vapor.

Label: Evaporator
Comment: An evaporator is a device in which a liquid refrigerent is vaporized and absorbs heat from the surrounding fluid.

Label: Fan
Comment: A fan is a device which imparts mechanical work on a gas. A typical usage of a fan is to induce airflow in a building services air distribution system.

Label: Filter
Comment: A filter is an apparatus used to remove particulate or gaseous matter from fluids and gases.

Label: Fire suppression terminal
Comment:
A fire suppression terminal has the purpose of delivering a fluid (gas or liquid) that will suppress a fire.

A fire suppression terminal provides for all forms of sprinkler, spreader and other form of terminal that is connected to a pipework system and intended to act in the role of suppressing a fire.

Label: Flow controller
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowController defines the occurrence of elements of a distribution system that are used to regulate flow through a distribution system. Examples include dampers, valves, switches, and relays.

subClass.Label: Flow meter
subClass.Comment: A flow meter is a device that is used to measure the flow rate in a system.

subClass.Label: Protective device
subClass.Comment:
A protective device breaks an electrical circuit when a stated electric current that passes through it is exceeded.

A protective device provides protection against electrical current only (not as a general protective device). It may be used to represent the complete set of elements including both the tripping unit and the breaking unit that provide the protection. This may be particularly useful at earlier stages of design where the approach to breaking the electrical supply may be determined but the method of tripping may not. Alternatively, this entity may be used to specifically represent the breaking unit alone (in which case the tripping unit will also be specifically identified). This entity is specific to dedicated protective devices and excludes electrical outlets that may have circuit protection.

subClass.Label: Switching device
subClass.Comment:
A switch is used in a cable distribution system (electrical circuit) to control or modulate the flow of electricity.

Switches include those used for electrical power, communications, audio-visual, or other distribution system types as determined by the available ports.

subClass.Label: Valve
subClass.Comment: A valve is used in a building services piping distribution system to control or modulate the flow of the fluid.

Label: Flow instrument
Comment:
A flow instrument reads and displays the value of a particular property of a system at a point, or displays the difference in the value of a property between two points.

Instrumentation is typically for the purpose of determining the value of the property at a point in time. It is not the purpose of an instrument to record or integrate the values over time (although they may be connected to recording devices that do perform such a function). This entity provides for all forms of mechanical flow instrument (thermometers, pressure gauges etc.) and electrical flow instruments (ammeters, voltmeters etc.)

Label: Flow meter
Comment: A flow meter is a device that is used to measure the flow rate in a system.

Label: Flow moving device
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowMovingDevice defines the occurrence of an apparatus used to distribute, circulate or perform conveyance of fluids, including liquids and gases (such as a pump or fan), and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

subClass.Label: Pump
subClass.Comment: A pump is a device which imparts mechanical work on fluids or slurries to move them through a channel or pipeline. A typical use of a pump is to circulate chilled water or heating hot water in a building services distribution system.

Label: Flow storage device
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowStorageDevice defines the occurrence of a device that participates in a distribution system and is used for temporary storage (such as a tank).

subClass.Label: Tank
subClass.Comment: A tank is a vessel or container in which a fluid or gas is stored for later use.

Label: Flow terminal
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowTerminal defines the occurrence of a permanently attached element that acts as a terminus or beginning of a distribution system (such as an air outlet, drain, water closet, or sink). A terminal is typically a point at which a system interfaces with an external environment.

subClass.Label: Lamp
subClass.Comment: A lamp is an artificial light source such as a light bulb or tube.

subClass.Label: Medical device
subClass.Comment: A medical device is attached to a medical piping system and operates upon medical gases to perform a specific function. Medical gases include medical air, medical vacuum, oxygen, carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and nitrous oxide.

subClass.Label: Outlet
subClass.Comment:
An outlet is a device installed at a point to receive one or more inserted plugs for electrical power or communications.

Power outlets are commonly connected within a junction box; data outlets may be directly connected to a wall. For power outlets sharing the same circuit within a junction box, the ports should indicate the logical wiring relationship to the enclosing junction box, even though they may be physically connected to a cable going to another outlet, switch, or fixture.

subClass.Label: Sanitary terminal
subClass.Comment: A sanitary terminal is a fixed appliance or terminal usually supplied with water and used for drinking, cleaning or foul water disposal or that is an item of equipment directly used with such an appliance or terminal.

subClass.Label: Space heater
subClass.Comment:
Space heaters utilize a combination of radiation and/or natural convection using a heating source such as electricity, steam or hot water to heat a limited space or area. Examples of space heaters include radiators, convectors, baseboard and finned-tube heaters.

UnitaryEquipment should be used for packaged units supporting a combination of heating, cooling, and/or dehumidification; Coil should be used for coil-based floor heating.

Label: Flow treatment device
Comment: The distribution flow element FlowTreatmentDevice defines the occurrence of a device typically used to remove unwanted matter from a fluid, either liquid or gas, and typically participates in a flow distribution system.

subClass.Label: Interceptor
subClass.Comment: An interceptor is a device designed and installed in order to separate and retain deleterious, hazardous or undesirable matter while permitting normal sewage or liquids to discharge into a collection system by gravity.

Label: Heat exchanger
Comment: A heat exchanger is a device used to provide heat transfer between non-mixing media such as plate and shell and tube heat exchangers. HeatExchanger is commonly used on water-side distribution systems to recover energy from a liquid to another liquid (typically water-based), whereas AirToAirHeatRecovery is commonly used on air-side distribution systems to recover energy from a gas to a gas (usually air).

Label: Humidifier
Comment: A humidifier is a device that adds moisture into the air.

Label: Interceptor
Comment: An interceptor is a device designed and installed in order to separate and retain deleterious, hazardous or undesirable matter while permitting normal sewage or liquids to discharge into a collection system by gravity.

Label: Lamp
Comment: A lamp is an artificial light source such as a light bulb or tube.

Label: Medical device
Comment: A medical device is attached to a medical piping system and operates upon medical gases to perform a specific function. Medical gases include medical air, medical vacuum, oxygen, carbon dioxide, nitrogen, and nitrous oxide.

Label: Outlet
Comment:
An outlet is a device installed at a point to receive one or more inserted plugs for electrical power or communications.

Power outlets are commonly connected within a junction box; data outlets may be directly connected to a wall. For power outlets sharing the same circuit within a junction box, the ports should indicate the logical wiring relationship to the enclosing junction box, even though they may be physically connected to a cable going to another outlet, switch, or fixture.

Label: Physical object
Comment: Any Object that has a proper space region.  (Definition extracted from DUL ontology)

Label: Protective device
Comment:
A protective device breaks an electrical circuit when a stated electric current that passes through it is exceeded.

A protective device provides protection against electrical current only (not as a general protective device). It may be used to represent the complete set of elements including both the tripping unit and the breaking unit that provide the protection. This may be particularly useful at earlier stages of design where the approach to breaking the electrical supply may be determined but the method of tripping may not. Alternatively, this entity may be used to specifically represent the breaking unit alone (in which case the tripping unit will also be specifically identified). This entity is specific to dedicated protective devices and excludes electrical outlets that may have circuit protection.

Label: Protective device tripping unit
Comment: A protective device tripping unit breaks an electrical circuit at a separate breaking unit when a stated electric current that passes through the unit is exceeded.

Label: Pump
Comment: A pump is a device which imparts mechanical work on fluids or slurries to move them through a channel or pipeline. A typical use of a pump is to circulate chilled water or heating hot water in a building services distribution system.

Label: Sanitary terminal
Comment: A sanitary terminal is a fixed appliance or terminal usually supplied with water and used for drinking, cleaning or foul water disposal or that is an item of equipment directly used with such an appliance or terminal.

Label: Sensor
Comment: A sensor is a device that measures a physical quantity and converts it into a signal which can be read by an observer or by an instrument.

Label: Shading device
Comment: Shading devices are purpose built devices to protect from the sunlight, from natural light, or screening them from view. Shading devices can form part of the facade or can be mounted inside the building, they can be fixed or operable.

Label: Solar device
Comment: A solar device converts solar radiation into other energy such as electric current or thermal energy.

Label: Space heater
Comment:
Space heaters utilize a combination of radiation and/or natural convection using a heating source such as electricity, steam or hot water to heat a limited space or area. Examples of space heaters include radiators, convectors, baseboard and finned-tube heaters.

UnitaryEquipment should be used for packaged units supporting a combination of heating, cooling, and/or dehumidification; Coil should be used for coil-based floor heating.

Label: Switching device
Comment:
A switch is used in a cable distribution system (electrical circuit) to control or modulate the flow of electricity.

Switches include those used for electrical power, communications, audio-visual, or other distribution system types as determined by the available ports.

Label: Tank
Comment: A tank is a vessel or container in which a fluid or gas is stored for later use.

Label: Transformer
Comment:
A transformer is an inductive stationary device that transfers electrical energy from one circuit to another.

Transformer is used to transform electric power; conversion of electric signals for other purposes is handled at other entities: Controller converts arbitrary signals, AudioVisualAppliance converts signals for audio or video streams, and CommunicationsAppliance converts signals for data or other communications usage.

Label: Transport element
Comment: A transport element is a generalization of all transport related objects that move people, animals or goods within a building or building complex. The TransportElement defines the occurrence of a transport element.

Label: Tube bundle
Comment: A tube bundle is a device consisting of tubes and bundles of tubes used for heat transfer and contained typically within other energy conversion devices, such as a chiller or coil.

Label: Unitary control element
Comment:
A unitary control element combines a number of control components into a single product, such as a thermostat or humidistat.

A unitary control element provides a housing for an aggregation of control or electrical distribution elements that, in combination, perform a singular (unitary) purpose. Each item in the aggregation may have its own geometric representation and location.

Label: Valve
Comment: A valve is used in a building services piping distribution system to control or modulate the flow of the fluid.

Label: Vibration isolator
Comment: A vibration isolator is a device used to minimize the effects of vibration transmissibility in a building.

Label: Building related
Comment: A building represents a structure that provides shelter for its occupants or contents and stands in one place. The building is also used to provide a basic element within the spatial structure hierarchy for the components of a building project (together with site, storey, and space).

Label: CO2 level
Comment: A property related to measurements of CO2 level in the air. Measured in ppm.

subClass.Label: Sensor
subClass.Comment: A device that detects and responds to events or changes in the physical environment such as light, motion, or temperature changes. Further, a device of category saref:Sensor that performs a saref:SensingFunction.

Label: Current
Comment: A property related to measurements measured in Ampere (A).

Label: Flow
Comment: A property related to measurements of rates of flow, measured in mÂ³/s. This may for instance be used to measure air flow in ventilation or water flow in district heating systems.

Label: Room
Comment: A room in a building. This class may be used to group devices.

Label: State of charge
Comment: A property related to measurements of the battery status of a device. Measured in %. 100 % means fully charged. 0 % no charge.

Label: Tenant
Comment: A class that describes information about a tenant in a building.

Label: Voltage
Comment: Voltage in Volts

Label: Volume
Comment: A property related to measurements measured in volume. Volume is measured in mÂ³.

Label: AC Meausrement
Comment: The Data Model intended to measure the electrical energies consumed by an electrical system which uses an Alternating Current (AC) for a three-phase (L1, L2, L3) or single-phase (L) and neutral (N). It integrates the initial version of the data Modem [THREEPHASEMEASUREMENT], extended to also perform single-phase measurements. It includes attributes for various electrical measurements such as power, frequency, current and voltage.

Label: Assembly Building
Comment: places used for people gathering for entertainment, worship, and eating or drinking. Examples: churches, restaurants.

subClass.Label: Cinema Building
subClass.Comment: A building in which movies are shown.

subClass.Label: Stadium Building
subClass.Comment: A building that has a large open area surrounded by many rows of seats, and  used for sports events, concerts, etc.

Label: Attic
Comment: the part of a building, especially of a house, directly under a roof; garret.

Label: Balcony
Comment: An accessible structure extending from a building, especially outside a window.

Label: Basement
Comment: A story of a building, partly or wholly underground.

Label: Bathroom
Comment: Bathroom is mainly used for bathing & washing up related activities.

Label: Bedroom
Comment: Bedroom is used mainly for sleeping.

Label: Building
Comment: Buildings are roofed constructions which can be used separately, have been built for permanent purposes, can be entered by persons and are suitable or intended for protecting persons, animals or objects.

subClass.Label: Non-Residential Building
subClass.Comment: A  non-residential building is a building at least half of which is used for other than residential purposes.

subClass.Label: Residential Building
subClass.Comment: A residential building is a building at least half of which is used for residential purposes.

Label: Building Space
Comment: A Space is a 3D volume bounded by surfaces. It represents the physical spaces of the building.

subClass.Label: Building Spatial Structure
subClass.Comment: A man made structure with spatial properties.

subClass.Label: Day Care
subClass.Comment: A place where infants and young children are provided a supervision and care of during the daytime, particularly so that their parents can hold jobs.

subClass.Label: Escalator
subClass.Comment: A moving staircase consisting of an endlessly circulating belt of steps driven by a motor, which conveys people between the floors of a public building (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Greenhouse
subClass.Comment: A building, room, or zone, usually chiefly of glass, in which the temperature is maintained within a desired range, used for cultivating tender plants or growing plants out of season.

subClass.Label: Kids Area
subClass.Comment: A place where infants or young children can play which is surrounded by a boundary normally. It can be both indoor and outdoor.

subClass.Label: Lobby
subClass.Comment: An entrance hall, corridor, or vestibule, as in a public building, often serving as an anteroom; foyer.

subClass.Label: Moving Pavement
subClass.Comment: A slow-moving conveyor mechanism that transports people across a horizontal or inclined plane over a short to medium distance (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Ramp
subClass.Comment: A sloping surface joining two different levels, as at the entrance or between floors of a building (Oxford Dictionary of English).

subClass.Label: Room
subClass.Comment: A room in a building space enclosed by surfaces, this could also be modelled as role of space, not subclass of the space itself.

subClass.Label: Stairs
subClass.Comment: A construction designed to bridge a large vertical distance by dividing it into smaller vertical distances, called steps.

subClass.Label: Suite
subClass.Comment: A suite of rooms usually on one floor of an apartmentÂ house (Cambridge English Dictionary). This term is normally used in hotels, resorts, guesthouses, etc.

Label: Building Spatial Structure
Comment: A man made structure with spatial properties.

subClass.Label: Building Storey
subClass.Comment: The storey represents a (nearly) horizontal aggregation of spaces that are vertically bound.

Label: Building Storey
Comment: The storey represents a (nearly) horizontal aggregation of spaces that are vertically bound.

Label: Corridor
Comment: A gallery or passage connecting parts of a building; hallway.

subClass.Label: Corridor Segment
subClass.Comment: A fragment or an atomic element of a corridor.

Label: Dining Room
Comment: A room in which meals are eaten, as in a home or hotel, especially the room in which the major or more formal meals are eaten.

Label: Door
Comment: the large flat piece of wood, glass etc that you move when you go into or out of a building, room, vehicle etc, or when you open a cupboard (Longman Dictionary of Contemporary English Online)

Label: Educational Building
Comment: Schools and day care centers.

Label: Elevator
Comment: Elevator is used to transport people between different floors.

Label: Greenhouse
Comment: A building, room, or zone, usually chiefly of glass, in which the temperature is maintained within a desired range, used for cultivating tender plants or growing plants out of season.

Label: Hall
Comment: A large entrance room of a house or building.

Label: Tree house
Comment: A work or office space set up in a person's home and used exclusively for business on a regular basis.

Label: Industrial Building
Comment: Buildings used for industrial production, e.g. factories, workshops, slaughterhouses, breweries, assembly plants, etc.

Label: Institutional Building
Comment: Institutions such as hospitals providing medical and surgical treatment and nursing care for ill or injured people.

Label: Kitchen
Comment: Kitchen is a room used mainly for cooking and possibly eating.

Label: Laundry
Comment: A room or zone, as in a home or apartment building, reserved for doing the family wash.

Label: Living Room
Comment: Living Room is the main room of daytime activity.

Label: Lobby
Comment: An entrance hall, corridor, or vestibule, as in a public building, often serving as an anteroom; foyer.

Label: Mercantile Building
Comment: Places where goods are displayed and sold. Examples: grocery stores, department stores, and gas stations.

subClass.Label: Shopping Mall Building
subClass.Comment: A set of one or more buildings forming a complex of shops representing merchandisers, with interconnecting walkways enabling visitors to easily walk from unit to unit, along with a parking area.

Label: Non-Residential Building
Comment: A  non-residential building is a building at least half of which is used for other than residential purposes.

Label: Office
Comment: A room, set of rooms, or building where the business of a commercial or industrial organization or of a professional person is conducted.

subClass.Label: Tree house
subClass.Comment: A work or office space set up in a person's home and used exclusively for business on a regular basis.

Label: Business Building
Comment: Places where services are provided. Examples: banks, insurance agencies.

Label: Residential Building
Comment: A residential building is a building at least half of which is used for residential purposes.

Label: Room
Comment: A room in a building space enclosed by surfaces, this could also be modelled as role of space, not subclass of the space itself.

subClass.Label: Storage Room
subClass.Comment: Room for storage.

subClass.Label: Swimming Pool
subClass.Comment: A tank or large artificial basin, as of concrete, for filling with water for swimming.

subClass.Label: Utility Room
subClass.Comment: Room for other special utilities and hobbies.

Label: Site Of Building
Comment: Building site is a locale containing one or more separate buildings. They are zones.

Label: Stairs
Comment: A construction designed to bridge a large vertical distance by dividing it into smaller vertical distances, called steps.

Label: Storage Room
Comment: Room for storage.

Label: Swimming Pool
Comment: A tank or large artificial basin, as of concrete, for filling with water for swimming.

Label: Utility Room
Comment: Room for other special utilities and hobbies.
